newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile mining output rises 21.5 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Chile mining output rises 21.5 pct in 1996.

text.p: Chile's mining output grew 24.6 percent in December compared with the same month in 1995, bringing the increase in 1996 to 21.5 percent, said the National Statistics Institute.
Metallic mining production soared 23 percent over the last year, while non-metallic output fell six percent.
The figures showed copper production rose 25 percent on 1995 with gold output up 16 percent and lead production rising 15 percent.
The sharpest decline was seen in manganesium output which fell 11 percent over the last year.
The institute did not give details of production figures in terms of volume or exports.
